item.title: Gunmen attack home of Afghan defence minister in Kabul
item.description: The minister was not at home during the first major attack by militants in Kabul for nearly a year.

item.title: MV Asphalt Princess: Suspected hijackers leave ship off UAE
item.description: Men who boarded a Panama-flagged bitumen tanker have now left the vessel, officials say.

item.title: Missouri governor pardons couple who pointed guns at protesters
item.description: Missouri's governor pardons the couple who pointed guns at Black Lives Matter protesters last year.

item.title: Belarus sprinter Krystina Timanovskaya flies out of Japan
item.description: Krystina Timanovskaya refused orders to fly home early and is now en route to Vienna.

item.title: China Covid: China targets school students to control case surge
item.description: Authorities in China are scrambling to control the spread of the virus by ramping up testing and vaccinations.

item.title: Andrew Cuomo: Biden says governor should resign over harassment report
item.description: The new report comes months after several women accused the New York governor of sexual misconduct.

item.title: Beirut blast: ‘The day our city exploded’
item.description: One year on from the blast that rocked Beirut, no one has yet been made accountable.

item.title: German pensioner given hefty fine for WW2 tank in house
item.description: The 82 year old is given a suspended sentence and fined €250,000 (£213,469).

item.title: Tokyo 2020: TikTok becomes the unofficial behind-the-scenes Olympic channel
item.description: The short-form video platform is giving fans unprecedented insight into the athletes' experience.

item.title: FBI used pictures of staff for undercover sex crime stings
item.description: A watchdog says the FBI put office staff in danger by using their photos to lure sexual predators.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Taiwan stars trolled by Chinese nationalists
item.description: Chinese nationalists interpreted support for Taiwan's athletes as support for the island's independence.

item.title: Li Auto: China Tesla rival plans Hong Kong secondary listing
item.description: The move comes as Chinese firms listed in the US face increasing scrutiny by Beijing and Washington.

item.title: Afghanistan war: Bodies on the streets as fighting traps Lashkar Gah residents
item.description: Terrified locals are fleeing if they can as the Taliban and troops battle to control Lashkar Gah.

item.title: Tunisia crisis: Democrats, despots and the fight for power
item.description: Tunisia is in turmoil since the president suspended parliament and increased his own power.

item.title: The downfall of Nissan's Carlos Ghosn: An insider's view
item.description: Former Nissan lawyer Ravinder Passi had a ringside seat of the downfall of chairman Carlos Ghosn.

item.title: Vitaly Shishov: Belarus dissidents who disappeared and died
item.description: For years opponents of Belarus leader Alexander Lukashenko have been hounded - sometimes fatally.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Chinese nationalists turn on their athletes
item.description: To ultra-nationalists online, losing an Olympic medal is being "unpatriotic", experts say.

item.title: ‘I can’t study sitting on the pavement’
item.description: Asma Shaikh, a 17-year-old homeless girl, has big dreams. But the pandemic has brought new challenges.

item.title: Ever Given: Time-lapse video captures Felixstowe arrival
item.description: "We could still see Egyptian sand on its bow," said film-maker Brian Abrams as the ship docked.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: A parent's plea in the shadow of the Olympics
item.description: This dad is drawing attention to what he calls the kidnapping of children by their own parents in Japan.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: 'You can take our flag but not our love for Russia'
item.description: Russia may be banned from the Olympics, but Russians are still winning medals – and rivals aren't happy.

item.title: Covid vaccine inequity 'completely unacceptable and unethical'
item.description: Rich countries need to do more to give vaccines to poor countries, says top WHO adviser Helen Clark.

item.title: Simone Biles: Tokyo 2020 medallist on 'unique Olympic experience'
item.description: American Simone Biles says she will "forever cherish" her "unique Olympic experience" after taking her overall Games medal haul to seven in Japan.

item.title: All you need to know about new climbing event
item.description: Climbing is the last of the new Olympic sports to make its appearance at Tokyo 2020. Here's a guide to the things you need to know.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Medal table - which country has won most golds?
item.description: Which country is leading the medal table? How are Great Britain getting on? Medals table for the 2020 Olympics in Tokyo.
